title: Ticket #888: ReadUserLog contructors do real work
description:
The ReadUserLog class constructors to real work and have no way of returning a status back, other than requiring the application to make a supplemental call to isInitialized(). I'd like to modify it in one of two ways:

  1. Eliminate all constructors that do real work
    • Leave only the default constructor
    • Require the application to call one of the initialize() methods

  2. Add a status return to the constructors that do real work
    • First parameter to all constructor would be 'int &status'
